div.p: Sometimes you’ll get given a brief, sometimes you’re given free-rein to do whatever you feel is necessary for a particular site
and then you start coming up with layouts, plans then once you’ve decided that a certain idea is a good idea you develop that further
by producing more detailed drawings, technical drawings, elevations, sections; it varies by job I think you know when I worked in Taiwan
it wasn’t wake up, go to the office, you’d probably get up, go to the site, inspect the site, if there’s any problems you draw up solutions
and then apply them so like because it was a small project we also participate in the building so if there was like a structural damage
we’d just replace whatever unit was there and fix it.
